RABEPRAZOLE SODIUM

PROTON PUMP INHIBITORS

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Side effects
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Benign gastric ulcer,

By mouth

  • For adults
    20 mg daily for 8 weeks, dose to be taken in the morning.

Duodenal ulcer,

By mouth

  • For adults
    20 mg daily for 4 weeks, dose to be taken in the morning.

Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease,

By mouth

  • For adults
    20 mg once daily for 4-8 weeks; maintenance 10–20 mg daily.

Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (symptomatic treatment in the absence of oesophagitis),

By mouth

  • For adults
    10 mg daily for up to 4 weeks, then 10 mg daily if required.

Zollinger–Ellison syndrome,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 60 mg once daily, adjusted according to response, doses above 100 mg daily given in 2 divided doses; maximum 120 mg per day.

Helicobacter pylori eradication in combination with amoxicillin or metronidazole and clarithromycin,

By mouth

  • For adults
    20 mg twice daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid—no information available.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Manufacturer advises caution in severe hepatic dysfunction.

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Cough, influenza like syndrome, rhinitis,

uncommon: Chest pain, nervousness,

rare: Anorexia, weight gain,

Prepared medicinal forms of RABEPRAZOLE SODIUM

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Gastro-resistant tablet
